channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: AGIbot Opts Out of 2026 Spring Festival Gala, Plans “Robot Wonderland Night”
item.description: AGIbot will not participate in the 2026 Spring Festival Gala, opting instead to channel resources into R&D and its own large-scale robot variety show, the "Robot Wonderland Night."

item.title: Douyin Named Exclusive Vertical-Video Streaming Partner for 2026 Spring Festival Gala
item.description: Douyin has been named the exclusive vertical-video live streaming partner for the 2026 CCTV Spring Festival Gala, offering viewers a dedicated mobile-friendly format alongside multiple viewing options.

item.title: Linghou Robotics Raises Over USD 13.8M in Pre-B Round Led by NIO Capital
item.description: Linghou Robotics, a core components maker for robots, secured over USD 13.8M in a Pre-B funding round led by NIO Capital, fueling its growth in both industrial automation and the burgeoning embodied intelligence sector.

item.title: Ant Group CEO Unveils “AI Credit” Incentive Program in Company-Wide Memo
item.description: Ant Group's CEO has launched a novel "AI Credit" incentive scheme, rewarding teams for groundbreaking AI work with convertible credits, emphasizing a full-scale push towards becoming an "AI-native" organization.

item.title: Ugreen Group Limited Files for Hong Kong IPO, Q1–Q3 2025 Revenue Surpasses Full-Year 2024
item.description: Ugreen Group Limited, a leading global consumer electronics brand, has filed for a Hong Kong IPO following a stellar performance on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange. Its revenue for the first three quarters of 2025 has already surpassed its total for the full year 2024, driven by strong international...

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Opus 4.5
item.description: Feb 2, 23:18 UTCResolved - Users experienced errors on Opus 4.5 between 15:09 PT / 23:09 UTC to 15:15 PT / 23:15.Feb 2, 23:15 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: What we’ve been getting wrong about AI’s truth crisis
item.description: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here. What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch...

item.title: Researchers Find 341 Malicious ClawHub Skills Stealing Data from OpenClaw Users
item.description: A security audit of 2,857 skills on ClawHub has found 341 malicious skills across multiple campaigns, according to new findings from Koi Security, exposing users to new supply chain risks. ClawHub is a marketplace designed to make it easy for OpenClaw users to find and install third-party skills....

item.title: Disruption with some GitHub services
item.description: Feb 2, 17:43 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Feb 2, 17:42 UTCUpdate - We’ve observed a low rate (~0.01%) of 5xx errors for HTTP-based...

item.title: OpenClaw Bug Enables One-Click Remote Code Execution via Malicious Link
item.description: A high-severity security flaw has been disclosed in OpenClaw (formerly referred to as Clawdbot and Moltbot) that could allow remote code execution (RCE) through a crafted malicious link. The issue, which is tracked as CVE-2026-25253 (CVSS score: 8.8), has been addressed in version 2026.1.29...

item.title: Please Don’t Feed the Scattered Lapsus Shiny Hunters
item.description: A prolific data ransom gang that calls itself Scattered Lapsus Shiny Hunters (SLSH) has a distinctive playbook when it seeks to extort payment from victim firms: Harassing, threatening and even swatting executives and their families, all while notifying journalists and… Read More »

item.title: Microsoft Begins NTLM Phase-Out With Three-Stage Plan to Move Windows to Kerberos
item.description: Microsoft has announced a three-phase approach to phase out New Technology LAN Manager (NTLM) as part of its efforts to shift Windows environments toward stronger, Kerberos-based options. The development comes more than two years after the tech giant revealed its plans to deprecate the legacy...

item.title: ShinyHunters-Branded Extortion Activity Expands, Escalates
item.description: Hackers rely on evolved vishing and login harvesting to compromise SSO credentials for unauthorized MFA enrollment. The post ShinyHunters-Branded Extortion Activity Expands, Escalates appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The crucial first step for designing a successful enterprise AI system
item.description: Many organizations rushed into generative AI, only to see pilots fail to deliver value. Now, companies want measurable outcomes—but how do you design for success? At Mistral AI, we partner with global industry leaders to co-design tailored AI solutions that solve their most difficult problems....

item.title: Open VSX Publisher Account Hijacked in Fresh GlassWorm Attack
item.description: A hacker published malicious versions of four established VS Code extensions to distribute a GlassWorm malware loader. The post Open VSX Publisher Account Hijacked in Fresh GlassWorm Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Default ICS Credentials Exploited in Destructive Attack on Polish Energy Facilities
item.description: Poland’s CERT has published a report on the recent attack, providing new details on targeted ICS and attribution. The post Default ICS Credentials Exploited in Destructive Attack on Polish Energy Facilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: inside a deepfake marketplace, and EV batteries’ future
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Inside the marketplace powering bespoke AI deepfakes of real women Civitai—an online marketplace for buying and selling AI-generated content, backed...

item.title: Latest open artifacts (#18): Arcee's 400B MoE, LiquidAI's underrated 1B model, new Kimi, and anticipation of a busy month
item.description: Tons of useful "niche" models and anticipation of big releases coming soon.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Malware and Cyberattacks in the Age of AI
item.description: Security leaders share how artificial intelligence is changing malware, ransomware, and identity-led intrusions, and how defenses must evolve. The post Cyber Insights 2026: Malware and Cyberattacks in the Age of AI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Proxy Botnet, Office Zero-Day, MongoDB Ransoms, AI Hijacks & New Threats
item.description: Every week brings new discoveries, attacks, and defenses that shape the state of cybersecurity. Some threats are stopped quickly, while others go unseen until they cause real damage. Sometimes a single update, exploit, or mistake changes how we think about risk and protection. Every incident shows...

item.title: Over 1,400 MongoDB Databases Ransacked by Threat Actor
item.description: Of 3,100 unprotected MongoDB instances, half remain compromised, most of them by a single threat actor. The post Over 1,400 MongoDB Databases Ransacked by Threat Actor appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Securing the Mid-Market Across the Complete Threat Lifecycle
item.description: For mid-market organizations, cybersecurity is a constant balancing act. Proactive, preventative security measures are essential to protect an expanding attack surface. Combined with effective protection that blocks threats, they play a critical role in stopping cyberattacks before damage is done....

item.title: What’s next for EV batteries in 2026
item.description: MIT Technology Review’s What’s Next series looks across industries, trends, and technologies to give you a first look at the future. You can read the rest of them here. Demand for electric vehicles and the batteries that power them has never been hotter. In 2025, EVs made up over a quarter of...

item.title: JAF: Judge Agent Forest
item.description: arXiv:2601.22269v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Judge agents are fundamental to agentic AI frameworks: they provide automated evaluation, and enable iterative self-refinement of reasoning processes. We introduce JAF: Judge Agent Forest, a framework in which the judge agent conducts joint inference...

item.title: The Six Sigma Agent: Achieving Enterprise-Grade Reliability in LLM Systems Through Consensus-Driven Decomposed Execution
item.description: arXiv:2601.22290v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models demonstrate remarkable capabilities yet remain fundamentally probabilistic, presenting critical reliability challenges for enterprise deployment. We introduce the Six Sigma Agent, a novel architecture that achieves...

item.title: Why Reasoning Fails to Plan: A Planning-Centric Analysis of Long-Horizon Decision Making in LLM Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.22311v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language model (LLM)-based agents exhibit strong step-by-step reasoning capabilities over short horizons, yet often fail to sustain coherent behavior over long planning horizons. We argue that this failure reflects a fundamental mismatch:...

item.title: Sparks of Rationality: Do Reasoning LLMs Align with Human Judgment and Choice?
item.description: arXiv:2601.22329v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly positioned as decision engines for hiring, healthcare, and economic judgment, yet real-world human judgment reflects a balance between rational deliberation and emotion-driven bias. If LLMs are to...

item.title: Learning Provably Correct Distributed Protocols Without Human Knowledge
item.description: arXiv:2601.22369v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Provably correct distributed protocols, which are a critical component of modern distributed systems, are highly challenging to design and have often required decades of human effort. These protocols allow multiple agents to coordinate to come to a...

item.title: Attention Isn't All You Need for Emotion Recognition:Domain Features Outperform Transformers on the EAV Dataset
item.description: arXiv:2601.22161v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a systematic study of multimodal emotion recognition using the EAV dataset, investigating whether complex attention mechanisms improve performance on small datasets. We implement three model categories: baseline transformers (M1), novel...

item.title: Multitask Learning for Earth Observation Data Classification with Hybrid Quantum Network
item.description: arXiv:2601.22195v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Quantum machine learning (QML) has gained increasing attention as a potential solution to address the challenges of computation requirements in the future. Earth observation (EO) has entered the era of Big Data, and the computational demands for...

item.title: Neural Signals Generate Clinical Notes in the Wild
item.description: arXiv:2601.22197v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Generating clinical reports that summarize abnormal patterns, diagnostic findings, and clinical interpretations from long-term EEG recordings remains labor-intensive. We curate a large-scale clinical EEG dataset with $9{,}922$ reports paired with...

item.title: FedAdaVR: Adaptive Variance Reduction for Robust Federated Learning under Limited Client Participation
item.description: arXiv:2601.22204v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Federated learning (FL) encounters substantial challenges due to heterogeneity, leading to gradient noise, client drift, and partial client participation errors, the last of which is the most pervasive but remains insufficiently addressed in current...

item.title: Causal Imitation Learning Under Measurement Error and Distribution Shift
item.description: arXiv:2601.22206v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study offline imitation learning (IL) when part of the decision-relevant state is observed only through noisy measurements and the distribution may change between training and deployment. Such settings induce spurious state-action correlations, so...

item.title: In Vino Veritas and Vulnerabilities: Examining LLM Safety via Drunk Language Inducement
item.description: arXiv:2601.22169v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Humans are susceptible to undesirable behaviours and privacy leaks under the influence of alcohol. This paper investigates drunk language, i.e., text written under the influence of alcohol, as a driver for safety failures in large language models...

item.title: MrRoPE: Mixed-radix Rotary Position Embedding
item.description: arXiv:2601.22181v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Rotary Position Embedding (RoPE)-extension refers to modifying or generalizing the Rotary Position Embedding scheme to handle longer sequences than those encountered during pre-training. However, current extension strategies are highly diverse and...

item.title: Prepare Reasoning Language Models for Multi-Agent Debate with Self-Debate Reinforcement Learning
item.description: arXiv:2601.22297v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The reasoning abilities of large language models (LLMs) have been substantially improved by reinforcement learning with verifiable rewards (RLVR). At test time, collaborative reasoning through Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) has emerged as a promising...

item.title: MERMAID: Memory-Enhanced Retrieval and Reasoning with Multi-Agent Iterative Knowledge Grounding for Veracity Assessment
item.description: arXiv:2601.22361v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Assessing the veracity of online content has become increasingly critical. Large language models (LLMs) have recently enabled substantial progress in automated veracity assessment, including automated fact-checking and claim verification systems....

item.title: Context Structure Reshapes the Representational Geometry of Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.22364v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) have been shown to organize the representations of input sequences into straighter neural trajectories in their deep layers, which has been hypothesized to facilitate next-token prediction via linear extrapolation....

item.title: Inside the marketplace powering bespoke AI deepfakes of real women
item.description: Civitai—an online marketplace for buying and selling AI-generated content, backed by the venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz—is letting users buy custom instruction files for generating celebrity deepfakes. Some of these files were specifically designed to make pornographic images banned by...

item.title: Thoughts on the job market in the age of LLMs
item.description: On standing out and finding gems.
